title.narrative: KtK Gender and EU, reg Western Balkans 2015-2020: WB
KtK Jämställdhet och EU reg Västra Balkan 2015-2020

description.narrative:
Programmet "Strengthening Women's Rights, Participation and Influence in the Western Balkans" har som övergripande syfte att bidra till ökad jämställdhetshänsyn i länderna i västra Balkan och att använda EU-integrationsprocessen (EUI) som hävstång för detta. KtK stödjer ett tiotal kvinnoorganisationer och nätverk i länderna på Balkan (Albanien, BiH, Kosovo, Serbien, Makedonien och Montenegro) att driva relevanta och evidensbaserade påverkanskampanjer gentemot ffa egna regeringar men även andra intressenter för att få dessa att ta ökade jämställdhetshänsyn inom ramen för EU-integrationsprocessen. Ökad kunskap och kompetens skall bibringas partnerorganisationerna kring både EU integrationsprocessen och hur man utformar strategiska påverkanskampanjer och bedriver effektivt kommunikationsarbete. KtK bidrar därutöver med att bygga nätverk och allianser över landsgränser och skapa relevanta kontakter inom EU:s institutioner.
Insatsen ses som en avslutande fas i KtKs arbete i regionen som pågått sedan 1990-talet. Denna insats bygger på tidigare erfarenheter och lärdomar, men har ett smalare och tydligare tematiskt fokus än tidigare samarbeten.

The programme "Strengthening Women's Rights, Participation and Influence in the Western Balkans, 2015-2020 builds on KtK's new regional strategy for the Western Balkans and aims at ensuring a strengthened gender perspective in the countries, using the EU integration process as a vehicle for change. KtK supports a selection of about 10 women's organisations and networks throughout the Balkan region (Albania, BiH, Kosovo, Serbia, Macedonia and Montenegro) to run evidence based and relevant advocacy campaigns. Advocacy efforts will primarily target national governments, but also other stakeholders. To optimise efforts, the partner organisations will strengthen their competence in both EUI processes, advocacy skills and communication. KtK also facilitates necessary regional networking and finds relevant entry points in the EU institutions.
The contribution is regarded a phase-out from earlier cooperation in the region, where KtK has been active since the wars of the 1990s. The present regional programme builds on previous experiences and lessons but has a more focussed thematic scope and is also smaller in funding volume as compared to earlier programs.

The programme "Strengthening Women's Rights, Participation and Influence in the Western Balkans, 2015-2020 builds on KtK's regional strategy for the Western Balkans and aims at ensuring a strengthened gender perspective in the countries, using the EU integration process as a vehicle for change. KtK supports a selection of about 10 women's organisations and networks throughout the Balkan region (Albania, BiH, Kosovo, Serbia, North Macedonia and Montenegro) to run evidence based and relevant advocacy campaigns. Advocacy efforts primarily targets national governments, but also other stakeholders. To optimise efforts, the partner organisations will strengthen their competence in both EU processes, advocacy skills and communication. KtK also facilitates necessary regional networking and finds relevant entry points in the EU institutions. The overall objective of the project is: An engendered EU accession and integration process: civil society is both partner and watchdog. The three intermediate objectives of the programme are: - Increased visibility of women’s human rights in EU accession documents; - Increased participation of women’s organisations in the EU accession process and - Increased prioritisation of women’s human rights by governments in the EU accession process.

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

tag.narrative: 5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

description.narrative: Kvinna till Kvinna were increasingly sought for its expertise and partnership with women's organisations in 2019. In Brussels circles partner organisations and Kvinna till Kvinna have built a reputation of being relevant, timely, accurate and updated, something that is confirmed by the recent evaluation. During 2019 Kvinna till Kvinna produced several reports that were appreciated and widely used and new indicators were included. The publication "Two steps forward, one step back - Gender analysis of EC Country Reports for the Western Balkans" provides a gender analysis of the Country Reports for all six countries, with graphical barometers that clearly communicate the extent of gender mainstreaming or lack thereof. The report provides practical recommendations to EC and EUDs on how to mainstream gender in future production of Country Reports. According to KtK this is appreciated as a gender checklist for EU officials (who informally compete for positive scores). This was made possible thanks to the EU Advocacy Associate in Brussels. The report Where is the Money for Women’s Rights Report was widely spead and some events showed that the recommendations had impact, for instance as some of the requests were reflected in regulations, and in increased funding for women´s rights organisations in the Western Balkans. There was also a strong interest in the report and direct follow-up from several EU Delegations/EU Office. During 2019, KtK Roma partners - the newer partner organisations - increased their personal and organisational involvement and contribution to the regional program. A set of positive changes happened in the one year period such as strengthened internal capacities in doing the advocacy work, thanks to continuous support, strengthened networking with other relevant stakeholders (including national, regional and international networks). Partners developed EU advocacy strategies and started their implementation, with stronger presence and involvement in country related processes and high level events on the rights of Roma. Kvinna till Kvinna also organised a specific meeting in Brusselsduring the November visit, with the key persons for Roma issues at the EC. KtK regards the fact that the Brussels advocacy week in 2020 could even be carried out as a success given the corona pandemic. It included advocacy meetings and public events online, something that would not have been possible without prior live meetings and platforms/relations built. They also saw visible developed capacities of partners, with excellent performance despite challenging circumstances. In terms of results, partners were specifically asked to provide input to the resolutions on the enlargement package. Kvinna till Kvinna was specifically invited to represent women’s organisations at an EIGE-meeting, within their IPA-programme. The meeting gathered state representatives, EU officials and Kvinna till Kvinna, sharing the advocacy points from partner organisations. Kvinna till Kvinna was invited thanks to public online events during the year, on Covid implications on women’s right in the region, and Where’s the Money for Women’s Rights-launches, that EIGE representatives attended and found very relevant. Kvinna till Kvinna also published and launched (online) the fifth version of the Women’s Rights in Westen Balkans, which was very well received, with large attendance and an active crowd.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
